verses.verse: Therefore<WG1352> leaving<WG863> the principles<WG746> of the doctrine<WG3056> of Christ<WG5547>, let us go on<WG5342> unto<WG1909> perfection<WG5047>; not<WG3361> laying<WG2598> again<WG3825> the foundation<WG2310> of repentance<WG3341> from<WG575> dead<WG3498> works<WG2041>, and<WG2532> of faith<WG4102> toward<WG1909> God<WG2316>, principles: or, word of the beginning of
Of the doctrine<WG1322> of baptisms<WG909>, and<WG5037> of laying on<WG1936> of hands<WG5495>, and<WG5037> of resurrection<WG386> of the dead<WG3498>, and<WG2532> of eternal<WG166> judgment<WG2917>.
And<WG2532> this<WG5124> will we do<WG4160>, if<WG1437> <WG4007> God<WG2316> permit<WG2010>.

And<WG2532> have tasted<WG1089> the good<WG2570> word<WG4487> of God<WG2316>, and<WG5037> the powers<WG1411> of the world<WG165> to come<WG3195>,

But<WG1161> that which beareth<WG1627> thorns<WG173> and<WG2532> briers<WG5146> is rejected<WG96>, and<WG2532> is nigh<WG1451> unto cursing<WG2671>; whose<WG3739> end<WG5056> is to<WG1519> be burned<WG2740>.

But<WG1161>, beloved<WG27>, we are persuaded<WG3982> better things<WG2909> of<WG4012> you<WG5216>, and<WG2532> things that accompany<WG2192> salvation<WG4991>, though<WG1499> we<WG2980> thus<WG3779> speak<WG2980>.

For<WG1063> God<WG2316> is not<WG3756> unrighteous<WG94> to forget<WG1950> your<WG5216> work<WG2041> and<WG2532> labour<WG2873> of love<WG26>, which<WG3739> ye have shewed<WG1731> <WG1731> toward<WG1519> his<WG846> name<WG3686>, in that ye have ministered<WG1247> to the saints<WG40>, and<WG2532> do minister<WG1247>.

And<WG1161> we desire<WG1937> that every one<WG1538> of you<WG5216> do shew<WG1731> the same<WG846> diligence<WG4710> to<WG4314> the full assurance<WG4136> of hope<WG1680> unto<WG891> the end<WG5056>:
That<WG3363> ye be<WG1096> not<WG3363> slothful<WG3576>, but<WG1161> followers<WG3402> of them who through<WG1223> faith<WG4102> and<WG2532> patience<WG3115> inherit<WG2816> the promises<WG1860>.
For<WG1063> when God<WG2316> made promise<WG1861> to Abraham<WG11>, because<WG1893> he could<WG2192> swear<WG3660> by<WG2596> no<WG3762> greater<WG3187>, he sware<WG3660> by<WG2596> himself<WG1438>,

And<WG2532> so<WG3779>, after he had patiently endured<WG3114>, he obtained<WG2013> the promise<WG1860>.

For<WG1063> men<WG444> verily<WG3303> swear<WG3660> by<WG2596> the greater<WG3187>: and<WG2532> an oath<WG3727> for<WG1519> confirmation<WG951> is to them<WG846> an end<WG4009> of all<WG3956> strife<WG485>.

That<WG2443> by<WG1223> two<WG1417> immutable<WG276> things<WG4229>, in<WG1722> which<WG3739> it was impossible<WG102> for God<WG2316> to lie<WG5574>, we might have<WG2192> a strong<WG2478> consolation<WG3874>, who<WG3588> have fled for refuge<WG2703> to lay hold<WG2902> upon the hope<WG1680> set before us<WG4295>:
